directions: Preheat a broiler. Arrange the bread slices on a rimmed baking sheet. Lightly toast the bread on one side, watching carefully to prevent burning, about 1 minute. Turn the bread over, spread with the goat cheese, and top with the bell peppers and beef. Broil until the beef is warmed through, about 1 minute.
While still hot, drizzle the open-face sandwiches with the vinegar, sprinkle with the basil and serve immediately. Serves 4.
Adapted from Williams-Sonoma Food Made Fast Series,
title: Beef & Goat Cheese Sandwiches
